page.title: 13CANON PYON'S ROADS-70yrs.AGO
page.content: A local man remembers that 70yrs. ago the roads were very dusty in summer and very muddy in winter.They were not tarmac-surfaced but made by rolling small,evenly sized lumps of stone with a steam-roller.One member of the road gang was a specialist who{'knapped'} stones into the right size.Each parish in the area was responsible for providing roadmaking stone.Quarried on Westhope Hill it was left in piles at the roadside ready for use.The main road (A4110) was much narrower than today.There were very few{cars }and people came out to see them when they passed by.Until the coming of{Yeoman's {bus service,}started in Canon Pyon by our informant's family,people relied on{carrier's carts}to carry them and their goods. The carriers even did shopping to order often delivering the goods as late as midnight!
